title: RShiny application for zebrabox data treatment
text: From raw data to live, interactive visualization.

title: RShiny application for zebrabox data treatment
RShiny application for zebrabox data treatment
section: Load or Create a Plate Plan
text:
Load or Create a Plate Plan
ZebraBox uses standard multi-well plates. Edge wells can show border effects. The app can generate a random plan. Download it as .xlsx or view it as a table and figure. If you already have a plan, load it and wait to see Upload complete to click on the button. Column names must follow the required format. What is a required format ? Click here to download a 96-well sample plate plan.

title: RShiny application for zebrabox data treatment
text:
Load Raw Data
Raw files must be in .xlsx. Convert your original .xls files before loading. When loading, wait to see Upload complete to click on the button. The number of raw files must match your plate plans.

title: RShiny application for zebrabox data treatment
text:
Choose Primary Mode

Tracking mode
Follows each subject’s path.
Yields distance moved, active time, and movement counts.
See details in the ZebraBox guide.
Quantization mode
Counts pixel color changes.
Yields high, medium, or low activity levels.
See details in the ZebraBox guide.

title: RShiny application for zebrabox data treatment
text:
Choose Secondary Mode

Light/Dark (LDM)
For experiments with light shifts (0–100% or 100–0%).
Works even if no change occurred.
Vibration/Rest (VM)
For experiments with vibration frequencies (Hz).

title: Antoine Tourret
text: Hi ! I’m a PhD student in aquatic ecotoxicology.  I’m currently investigating the toxicity of micro and nanoplastic on aquatic organisms.  Additionally, I manage data processing, visualization, and produce visually engaging reports using Quarto.

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Contact Information

Date of Birth: December 17, 2000

Email: antoinetourretpro@gmail.com

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/antoine-tourret-b70672175

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Professional Summary
PhD candidate in ecotoxicology with expertise in assessing the impacts of emerging pollutants (e.g., nanoplastics, optical brighteners, glyphosate) on aquatic organisms. Skilled in experimental design, algal and microbial cultures, and data analysis using R. Passionate about data visualization.

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Education

Master’s in Ecotoxicology and Environmental Chemistry, International Track MOBBIDIQ
University of Bordeaux – INRS Québec
2021 – 2023 (GPA: 15.5/20)
Main subjects: Aquatic ecotoxicology, analytical chemistry, biostatistics, regulations.
Bachelor’s (L3) in Life Sciences - Organisms and Ecosystems
University of Bordeaux
2020 – 2021 (GPA: 14.8/20)
Main subjects: Cellular toxicology, ecosystem dynamics and biodiversity, biostatistics.
DUT in Biological Engineering, Environmental Engineering Option
IUT Grand Ouest Normandie, Caen
2018 – 2020 (GPA: 14.4/20)
Main subjects: Biochemistry, general and organic chemistry, microbial ecology, ecotoxicology.

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Professional Experience

PhD Thesis
Laboratoire Eau Environnement et Systèmes Urbains – University Paris Est Créteil, Créteil, France
Supervision: L. GARRIGUE-ANTAR and T. SRIKANTHASAMY
October 2024 – Present

Ecotoxicological impacts of micro- and nanoplastics on freshwater organisms and evaluation of the toxicity of nanoplastics treatments by advanced oxidation processes.

Research Engineer
Laboratoire Eau Environnement et Systèmes Urbains – University Paris Est Créteil, Créteil, France
Supervision: L. GARRIGUE-ANTAR
February 2024 – September 2024

Monitoring the ecotoxic potential of nanoplastics and their degradation products during and after advanced oxidation processes in microcrustacean and unicellular algae models (ANR-22-CE04-0011-02).

M2 Internship
Institut National de la Recherche pour l’Agriculture et l’Environnement, Cestas, France
Supervision: C. BONNINEAU
January 2023 – June 2023

Study of the ecotoxicological potential of glyphosate, AMPA, and optical brighteners on a pond phytoplankton biofilm and on monospecific algal cultures.

Master’s Internship (Bi-Diploma Program)
Institut National de la Recherche Scientifique, Centre Eau-Terre-Environnement, Montréal & Québec, Canada
Supervision: I. LAVOIE and P. JUNEAU
January 2022 – June 2023

Study of the ecotoxicological potential of optical brighteners on a river periphytic biofilm and on monospecific algal cultures in axenic conditions.

L3 Internship
Laboratoire Eau Environnement et Systèmes Urbains – University Paris-Est Créteil, Créteil, France
Supervision: L. GARRIGUE-ANTAR & F. SANDRE
May 2021 – June 2021

Study of the ecotoxicological potential of paraben substitutes in a zebrafish larva model within the COSMET’EAU project.

DUT Internship
Laboratoire Eau Environnement et Systèmes Urbains – University Paris-Est Créteil, Créteil, France
Supervision: L. GARRIGUE-ANTAR & F. SANDRE June 2020

Data processing using RStudio for ecotoxicological tests of a mixture of pharmaceutical pollutants on a zebrafish larva model within the OPUR5 program.

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Publications & Communications

Articles to be Published

Ecotoxicological effects of optical brighteners agents on the growth and photosynthesis of Chlorella vulgaris and Microcystis aeruginosa. 2024. A. Tourret, M. Laviale, I. Lavoie, C. Bonnineau & P. Juneau.
Assessment of the toxic effects of an optical brightener agent alone and in mixture with glyphosate and its main metabolite (aminomethylphosphonic acid) on freshwater benthic microbial communities. 2025. A. Tourret, M. Laviale, P. Juneau, I. Lavoie, S. Morin, D. Milan-Navarro, A. Moreira, N. Mazzella & C. Bonnineau. Targeted journal: FEMS Microbiology Ecology.



Communications

Poster: Characterization of the ecotoxicological potential of polystyrene nanoplastics that have or have not undergone advanced oxidation processes on Chlamydomonas reinhardtii and Daphnia magna. A. Tourret, L. Garrigue-Antar. Annual Congress of the Francophone Society for Environmental Health, November 2024.
Video: Flash edition 20h: Optical brighteners in French waterways, impacts on aquatic organisms. A. Tourret. Joint Ecotoxicology Colloquium Chapter Saint-Laurent-EcotoQ, June 2022, Québec, Canada.
First prize in the international scientific popularization contest, video category.
Flash Talk: Monitoring the response of biofilms and snails to optical brighteners. A. Tourret. 31st Annual Symposium of the Interuniversity Research Group in Limnology, March 2022, Montréal, Canada.
Second prize for the best short presentation, M.Sc. category.

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Teaching Experience

Chemical Risks (Bachelor Year 1): Lectures and practical work (6 hours and 9 hours).

Statistical Tools (Bachelor Year 2): Tutorials and practicals (13.5 hours and 8 hours).

Statistical Tools (Bachelor Year 3): Tutorials and practicals (4.5 hours).

title: Antoine Tourret - Curriculum Vitae
text:
Skills and Interests

Scientific Skills: Sample preparation in synchronous fluorescence spectroscopy / LC-MS, training in HPLC-UV, mastery of monospecific algal cultures (Chlorella vulgaris, Microcystis aeruginosa, Chlamydomonas reinhardtii, Raphidocelis subcapitata) in axenic or non-axenic conditions and periphytic microbial cultures, development of Daphnia cultures (Daphnia magna), design of experimental setups for OECD acute toxicity tests or non-regulated chronic toxicity tests.
IT Skills: RStudio, RShiny app, Quarto, Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Languages: French (native), English (C1).
Personal Interests: Running (half-marathon: 1:39:43), weight training (muscle strengthening and nutrition), table tennis (Xu Xin the GOAT), music (guitar, a bit of piano).
